channel.description: Recent content in vlang on Siwei's Blog

item.title: Implementing Linked Lists in Vlang
item.description: In V’s documentation, it says: V’s references are similar to Go pointers and C++ references. For example, a generic tree structure definition would look like this: 1 2 3 4 5 struct Node<T>{valTleft&Noderight&Node} However, I found that it seems impossible to initialize such a Node. A new Node must define the initial values for its left and right references, which are Nodes that need their left and right values initialized as well.
